comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
Often one knows an issue by the JIRA issue key.  Task Search should allow one to search by issue key.

More information:
Does "Open Repository Task" (Ctrl+Shift+F12) work for Jira? If so (I don't use Jira...) I think this provides the feature you want.

Willian, it supposed to, but unfortunately it is broken now because of the ancient issue with the task handle.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Willian, it supposed to, but unfortunately it is broken now because of the
> ancient issue with the task handle.

I wonder for what reason it is not allowed. Is it because of the way the task data filename is built from handle?
The '-' is a separator between repository url and the task id, but still, it is unclear, why dash in the id itself is prohibited. Mik, do you have anything to say in your defence?

The dash was chosen as a separator for handles before JIRA was on the table.  There are ways around this, e.g. encoding the dash as another character, or hashing the key to an int.  This will be addressed along with bug 170587 and bug 149624.

Alan: once bug 166174 is fixed, your request will be supported via the Open Repository Task dialog.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 166174 ***
